question: [File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Binding Factor Attacks] [Factor Reuse - High] Could binding factors from one session be reused in another session?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Aggregation] [Nonce Aggregation Forgery - Critical] Could an attacker manipulate the aggregated nonce R by choosing malicious commitments?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Aggregation] [Partial Aggregation - High] What happens if only a subset of participants' commitments are aggregated?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Aggregation] [Aggregation Order - High] Does the order of aggregation affect the final result?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Aggregation] [Missing Participant - High] What happens if nonces() is called with a participant who never inserted commitments?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [API Misuse] [Nonce Exposure - High] Could the pub(crate) visibility accidentally expose Nonce outside the frost module?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [API Misuse] [Premature Binding - High] Could bound() be called before calculate_binding_factors causing panics?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [API Misuse] [Double Calculation - Medium] What happens if calculate_binding_factors is called twice?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [API Misuse] [Generator Mismatch - High] Could planned_nonces in nonces() have different structure than generators in read()?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Participants] [Participant ID Range - Medium] Are Participant IDs validated to be in valid range when converted to field elements?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Participants] [Participant Collision - High] Could different participants map to the same field element in the transcript?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Participants] [Participant Removal - Medium] Is there a way to remove a participant's commitments once inserted?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Participants] [Threshold Enforcement - Critical] Does the BindingFactor structure enforce that at least t participants contribute?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Field Operations] [Zero Scalar - High] What happens if a nonce scalar is zero, and does this compromise security?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Field Operations] [Scalar Overflow - Low] Could operations on C::F overflow or wrap around?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Field Operations] [Field Inversion - N/A] Are there any field inversions that could fail for zero (appears none)?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Vector Operations] [Reallocation Timing - Low] Do vector reallocations in commitment generation leak timing information?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Vector Operations] [Capacity Waste - Low] Could oversized capacity allocations waste memory in long-running validators?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Vector Operations] [Vector Bounds - Medium] Are all vector accesses bounds-checked, or could invalid indices cause panics?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Line 59-60] [Nonce Generation - Critical] Are two separate C::random_nonce calls guaranteed to produce independent random values?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Line 66-68] [Scalar Multiplication - Medium] Do the scalar multiplications *generator * nonce.0[i].deref() execute in constant time?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Line 92-93] [Transcript Labels - High] Are the labels b'commitment_D' and b'commitment_E' globally unique across all FROST contexts?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Line 164] [Participant Encoding - High] Could C::F::from(u64::from(u16::from(*l))) lose information or overflow?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Line 169] [Binding Factor Derivation - Critical] Is C::hash_binding_factor applied to the correct challenge bytes?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/nonce.rs] [Line 176] [Unwrap Panic - High] Could binding_factors.as_ref().unwrap() panic if calculate_binding_factors was never called?
